content.question: For which of the following functions would the quotient rule be considered the best method for finding the derivative?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, 2 x, plus 1, close parenthesis, raised to the negative one half power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator 2 x, plus 1, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the inverse sine of open parenthesis, 2 x, plus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator the sine of open parenthesis, 2 x, plus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 x, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator the sine of open parenthesis, 2 x, plus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 x, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
